title: Incredible food and great value
text:
This place is amazing, by far my favourite restaurant I’ve been to so far in Athens. The food is Greek with a modern twist and it’s great quality. Highly recommend the zucchini balls and any of the cheese pastries but it’s all good.

I also took part in a cooking lesson with one of their chefs at the hotel and it was awesome, would highly recommend as you get a meal as part of it. You have the bits you cook yourself but also a ton of extra dishes and some wine, was amazing value for money.

title: Acropolis amazing, walk was surprisingly easy!
text:
So obviously the Acropolis was amazing but the main thing I want to talk about is the walk to the top.

A lot of the reviews make out the walk up to be a bit of a nightmare. I am very very unfit and it was a piece of cake. I was so over prepared, I brought my hiking shoes, gym leggings and a massive bottle of water and honestly It’s a gentle uphill stroll with a few steps here and there. I was honestly shocked when we got to the top.

If you are elderly or disabled I could see this being tough but I think it’s the same as walking up any steep road in Athens because it’s well staggered.

It might be different in the height of summer but it’s honestly nothing to over prep for. Do start from the Acropolis metro side though if you want a longer walk round to the top.

title: A few exceptional pieces comically odd staff
text:
Firstly the building itself and the garden inside are beautiful. When we were greeted inside one of the staff specified that we could take pictures but NEVER in funny poses. She then proceeded to demonstrate what a normal pose would be which was very very funny. Overall the staff did seem a bit on edge the whole time which was odd.

The pieces themselves are a mixed bag but they do have the earliest example of an ancient computer which is a must see. On the other hand the vases section must be about a mile long and a lot of the museum is dedicated to ornamental statues found on graves.

Worth a stop though for sure just for a few of the pieces. Didn’t stop at the cafe, looked a bit dingy despite the beautiful garden outside.

title: Lovely museum and idyllic cafe
text:
A small but very stylish museum, really well curated with a few really nice collections. Was impressed with the display of the items as it was far superior to how the other museums display/preserve their pieces.

The cafe and the shop are excellent. The cafe had amazing cake and the shop was full of great books in English as well as Greek
place: Athens Museum of Cycladic Art Admission Ticket

title: Great Food Wonderful Atmosphere
text: This place was wonderful, it is tucked away next to the beautiful church. The food was great and the service was extremely friendly. The man who plays the piano is very good too. Would highly reccomend.

title: Beautiful & Unique Hotel
text: If you want to experience the best of Sibiu this is a great place to stay. It is situated in the beautiful old town, a stones throw away from the main square. The building is a beautiful restored house and the rooms are massive. The staff went out of their way to make sure we had a lovely time despite us arriving early. Great value too, would highly reccomend.

title: Best Ribs of my life
text: The food in this place is truly exceptional. Can not reccomend highly enough, it's casual food but it feels very gourmet because the meat is so great. Service was great and the staff were very friendly. 5 stars.

title: Interesting buildings but not lots to see
text:
Overall I would say this was a pleasant day out, but it feels like more of a park than a museum. There are lots and lots of buildings to look at here but not really any exhibits per say. All the buildings are locked and some were full of storage equipment for the park. It wouldn't take much for this museum to fill some of the house interiors and then it would be excellent.

There are also lots of great market stalls and a lovely cafe so you can easily make an afternoon of it.

title: Impressive building
text: This was one me and my partner went to to tick it off a list of things you have to see in Bucharest. It is absolutely huge and very impressive but I wouldn't say it was particularly pretty. We tried to get closer but there were a lot of very big busy roads and roadworks in front. Its quite hard to get to on foot.

title: Full of hookers
text: Don't go here. My husband is half Chinese and as soon as we parked I got shouted at by an aggressive group of prostitutes who i assume wanted me off their turf. I assume that's not true of every part of the complex but there were a lot of aggressive hookers.

title: Hostile teenagers
text: Very weird experience. Was in and out in less than five minutes. Mid day on a monday and the place was heaving with underage teenagers smoking and drinking. They also would not stop staring and me and my husband (who is not white) which we get a bit of obviously but never to this extent, it was extremely uncomfortable.

title: Amazing building
text: This place is stunning inside, the whole place is covered in beautiful painted frescos. Cannot overstate how pretty it is. The food was pretty good overall and reasonably priced. The service wasn't very good from our waiter but It was very busy and the staff seemed quite stretched, it happens.

title: Amazing building + lots of English books
text: This shop is awesome, the building is stunning and massive. Reminds me of waterstones in England a lot in terms of the stock but a bit classier. There are loads of English books, an amazing film selection, franchise merchandise and Romanian tourist stuff. Definitely worth a visit! Favorite shop in Bucharest.

title: Great fun place, watch for extra charges
text: This place is great fun, well thought out design so that kids and adults won't mix. Good clean modern facilities. Pool bar was excellent and reasonably priced but avoid the restaurant because it's expensive.. To avoid the charges other reviews talk about, bring your own towel, swimming costume and flip flops and do not wear them in. Have them clean and in a bag. If you do that you should be fine.

title: Nice Collection, Very Quiet
text:
We actually visited this museum by mistake but once we paid the very reasonable price of two lei each to get in we were greeted by a very pleasant collection of Romanian folk art collected by Dr. Nicolae Minovici. The museum is very small but on the plus side is extremely quiet so you basically get a free guided tour from the very nice staff.

We were also told there was a collection of communist era artwork in a nearby building. We weren't told that it was a collection of erotica (maybe not one to visit with children) but throughly enjoyed it non the less.

title: Great for kids, horrendous lighting
text: Overall this museum is pretty good. Lots of the taxidermy was very well done. Could see how this place is great for kids. However the lighting in this museum is a headache inducing nightmare. It cycles from bright neon to pitch black seemingly at random, I was physically dizzy after two exhibits. If they looked at improving this it would be excellent.
place: Grigore Antipa National Museum of Natural History

title: Kind of creepy
text: Granted I didn't get off to the best start in Constanta after our car was attacked by feral dogs, but I don't really get the fuss about Constanta. It pales in comparison to squares in Transylvania largely because a lot of the buildings are much more soviet. The whole area had a very derelict vibe.

title: Nice food with a view
text: The food here is good and the service very friendly, it has a lovely view of the harbour. Great lemonades. The only thing was that we sat inside (because it was very busy) and found that the inside tables were a little sticky. Otherwise great place.

title: Hidden Gem
text: Me and my partner loved this place. It is tucked away from the main craziness near the council square and has a wonderful decor and atmosphere. The food and the wine are both excellent and the prices are very good value.

title: Beautiful historical town
text: The best thing about Brasov really is just Brasov itself. The historic part of town is very beautiful with loads of great restaurants. A very beautiful romantic feeling place with the added bonus of being surrounded by the most amazing mountains.

title: Nice park
text:
The park is ok, the lake area is quite nice. If you are looking for an afternoon stroll this is the place in Brasov, possibly not a whole day out unless you have kids.

There was quite a lot of rubbish scattered through the surrounding woods though.

title: Great new addition to Walthamstow
text: Had breakfast here. Food was amazing, really great attentive service too. Great addition to the mall area

title: Great Quality Food
text: Have visited this restaurant a few times now and it is in me and my partner's top 3 dinner places in Brasov. The food is consistently excellent quality and the service is very good. Can be crowded during peak times but always maintains a nice atmosphere. Would 100% recommend for people visiting Brasov for the first time.

title: Great Pasta
text: The food here is really great, I think the best pasta in Brasov and there are a few contenders. Atmosphere is good but the place is quite small so make a reservation when its busy to make sure you get a place.

title: Good Quality Romanian Cuisine
text: This would be a great place to start if this is your first time visiting Romania. Has the best traditional Romanian food in an area saturated with a lot of Italian food. The cabbage rolls were great recommendation from other reviews. Service was fast and the waiter who served us was very nice.

title: Never even got in the door
text: This was a very odd experience. To be clear me and my partner did not eat here so cannot comment on the food. We stood waiting to be seated for a long time in an empty restaurant while three employees stood by the bar chatting. They looked at us, definitely saw us and then just went back to their conversation. We left.

title: Great Coffee & Nice Atmosphere
text: Really nice place, much better value than most of the restaurants in Brasov because its off the beaten path. Have visited a few times with my partner and had a variety of things. The waiters are always very friendly and helpful.

title: Great Burgers
text: For a quick good value meal this place is great. The burgers are good quality and the service is excellent. Their lemonades are really good as well. Would highly recommend. The homemade crisps are a unique touch.

title: Nice food good service
text: This is a great place. The food and the coffee is very good. The service was very quick and the waitress was very friendly. Sitting outside for dinner during a Friday night probably was a mistake on our part, the outside seating is on the main historic street which, though very pretty, generates a lot of foot traffic.

title: A great birthday lunch
text:
Came here on a day trip to Sibiu for my birthday and couldn't have been happier with our choice. The courtyard is a really great escape from the busy and hot (it was august) main streets. Wonderful atmosphere.

The food was great and arrived quickly and the service was excellent.

Would highly recommend.

title: Very unique cathedral
text:
Entrance here is free which was a nice surprise considering a lot of churches/cathedrals in this region charge for entry. Very beautiful unique interior, definitely worth visiting. The shop on site was also very pleasant.

Possibly not a place for very young children as people were praying and it was important to keep quiet, but if you have kids that understand this then shouldn't be a problem.

title: Extremely beautiful city
text: Its no wonder that this whole town is protected from redevelopment, it is extremely unique and beautiful. It feels totally unique. There's nothing too see per say here except the houses and the bridge of lies but me and my partner were perfectly happy to just walk around and take pictures. Its a very small city so it won't take very long and its 100% worth it.

title: Skip Bran castle and go here instead!
text:
We went here during sunset during a thunderstorm and the views were absolutely incredible. Worth it alone for the photos. And history wise it is pretty great as well, feels like walking through a film set. Its also huge so you never feel crowded.

Ticket price very reasonable, great place for kids as well.

title: Lovely little restaurant great value
text: Me and my husband loved this place the three times we visited. It's tucked away in a little side street away from the very busy square. Our waiter was Peter who was always very friendly and accommodating. The menus are beautifully designed and the food is great. Good value for money too in quite a touristy city.

title: Overcrowded and a little disappointing
text:
So when I went I obviously knew this had nothing to do with Dracula. i assume everyone else knew this too. It is STAGGERING how busy this place is. You cannot move inside this small castle for the people. I think if they regulated entry times and had people go in in groups then it would be a very pleasant experience.

Prices were reasonable and the castle itself is nice.
